decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling a board presence quickly through mana acceleration and disruptive artifacts. By utilizing Mishra's Workshop and other mana rocks, the deck can cast powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem ahead of schedule. Additionally, disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere can slow down opponents, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast start and disruption while leveraging its mana advantage to pull ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt opponent's strategies while generating card advantage through card draw and manipulation. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells while setting up powerful combo plays using artifacts like Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel. The deck also includes tutors to find key pieces quickly and has access to powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain tempo advantage. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the game's pace, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through card advantage and combo finishes.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and protection. It leverages powerful artifacts like Sol Ring, Black Lotus, and Mana Crypt to generate mana quickly, while utilizing cards like Balance, Mental Misstep, and Force of Will to control the board and shut down opponents' strategies. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler for additional control and card advantage. With access to tutor effects like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, as well as powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Timetwister, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and establish dominance in the late game.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while maintaining control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk alongside efficient creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Orcish Bowmasters. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recurring key threats or resources. With a mix of disruption, card selection, and powerful spells, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and grind out incremental advantages to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard interactions to quickly fill the board with creatures such as Golgari Thug, Ichorid, and Narcomoeba. By utilizing cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam, the deck can deal damage to the opponent while also developing a strong board presence. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. Bazaar of Baghdad is used to dig through the deck and fill the graveyard efficiently, allowing the deck to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing Hatebear creatures and disruptive spells to slow down the opponent while also maintaining pressure with aggressive creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by taxing their spells with cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, as well as utilizing Wasteland and Strip Mine to control their mana base. By using powerful hate cards alongside aggressive creatures, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced Vintage 1 vs 1 match.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana through artifacts such as Moxen, Sol Ring, and Grim Monolith, allowing for powerful plays early in the game. It also includes various artifact creatures like Scrawling Crawler and Glaring Fleshraker to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Mystic Forge and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to manipulate the top of the library and find key pieces. Additionally, it features disruptive elements such as Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to control the opponent's game plan. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast mana and threats while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board using counter spells and disruptive cards while setting up the combo of Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play. By forcing the opponent to sacrifice creatures with Forbidden Orchard, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Flash can quickly finish off the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Null Rod and Boseiju, Who Endures, as well as card draw and tutors to find key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the combo for a quick win.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to slow down the opponent's game plan, making it difficult for them to cast their spells effectively. By using hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, along with disruptive lands like Strip Mine and Wasteland, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from executing their strategy. The inclusion of powerful mana acceleration cards like Moxen and Chrome Mox allows the deck to establish a fast clock while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures while disrupting opponents with hate cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Archon of Emeria. It also aims to generate mana advantage with fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Chrome Mox. The main strategy is to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures while controlling the game with disruptive hate cards to create a tempo advantage. The deck aims to capitalize on its early aggression and disruption to close out games quickly before opponents can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly filling your graveyard with Dredge creatures and using them to create a powerful board presence. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Noxious Revival, you can consistently dredge through your deck and put creatures like Narcomoeba, Ichorid, and Golgari Grave-Troll onto the battlefield. Cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam provide additional value when you dredge, while the inclusion of disruption like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void helps protect your combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around graveyard synergy and explosive turns.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures while slowing down the opponent with hate cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by limiting their resources and forcing them to play at a slower pace. The deck also incorporates mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and the Moxen, allowing for quicker plays and a faster clock. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive hate cards creates a strong and versatile strategy that can be difficult for the opponent to overcome.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and disruptive spells while utilizing the powerful combo of Oath of Druids to cheat big creatures into play. The strategy revolves around getting Oath of Druids onto the battlefield through various means like Show and Tell or Flash, then using it to put powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play for free. The deck also includes other powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Force of Will to help ensure the player's success in controlling the game and winning through the Oath of Druids combo.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures such as Clarion Conqueror and Seasoned Dungeoneer. It aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland and Void Mirror, while utilizing mana acceleration from Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats. Karakas provides protection against legendary creatures, while Cavern of Souls ensures that your creatures can't be countered. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong offense.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces of Coveted Jewel, utilizing powerful artifacts like The One Ring and key cards such as Tinker and Time Vault. With a strong mana base including Mishra's Workshop and Tolarian Academy, the deck aims to generate immense card advantage with Paradoxical Outcome and control the game with Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional utility, while Manifold Key allows for combo potential with Coveted Jewel. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its power.

This deck utilizes the Paradoxical Outcome combo to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, allowing for explosive plays and chaining multiple spells together. It includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Mana Crypt, and Black Lotus to ramp up quickly and overwhelm opponents. With the ability to draw cards, generate mana, and control the board, this deck aims to set up a winning board state quickly and efficiently. It combines artifacts and spells to create a synergistic engine that can lead to swift victories in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.
